intro: Soja hamata, commonly known as the Japanese thornapple, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley. The plant features compound leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. Its fruit is a schizocarp, splitting into two one-seeded parts when mature. Soja hamata is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
